conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m very eager to join School_C. I’m applying because School_C is one of my top choices and I would be excited to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I am only 3rd in School_B's priority list (behind Student_E and Student_B). Student_A and Student_D also rank School_B first, so competition is intense and I could be rejected. My 2nd choice School_C ranks me 2nd (behind only Student_B). Since Student_B’s top choice is School_A, there is a good chance Student_B applies to School_A first, making School_C a strong and realistic target for an early secure match while still very high on my true preference list. Therefore I will apply to School_C now.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_C. After reviewing applicants in this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: School_C has quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_C and Student_B. On School_C’s true priority list, Student_B is ranked #1 and Student_C is ranked #2. Since accepting Student_C now would fill the only seat and foreclose the chance to match with the highest-priority Student_B (who has already applied this round), the optimal decision to maximize School_C’s outcome is to reject Student_C and preserve capacity for Student_B.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited by the academic environment and the chance to contribute to campus life. If admitted, I would be ready to commit and engage fully in your programs. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me 4th (behind E, D, A), so my acceptance chance there is low if those students apply. School_C ranks me 1st, making it the safest way to secure a high-ranked option (3rd on my list) early. Since capacities are 1, locking in a strong, likely acceptance quickly is valuable. I will apply to School_C emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. After reviewing candidates this round and given our limited capacity, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C.

We’re excited about the contributions you would bring to our community and look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: School_C has quota 1 and true priority list ranks Student_B highest. In this round, Student_B and Student_C applied. Accepting Student_B maximizes School_C’s outcome and secures the top-ranked candidate immediately. Student_B’s preferences place School_C as 3rd, but their message indicates readiness to commit if accepted; given the mechanism, an [ACCEPT] upon [APPLY] finalizes the match, so taking Student_B now is optimal. Student_C is ranked below Student_B, so even if Student_B were uncertain, holding out would risk losing the top choice without improving beyond Student_B.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—I'm Student_D. School_B is my first-choice school, and if admitted I will accept and enroll. I’m excited about the academic environment and would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me 4th, early application is still my best chance, and delaying would only reduce options if I get displaced elsewhere. I will clearly express strong interest and commitment to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for ranking School_B as your first choice. After reviewing current applications and our admission priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the best in the rest of the process.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLYs from Student_D and Student_A; D ranks higher than A, so if I must choose between them, D is preferable. However, Student_E (my top choice) and Student_B/C (also higher than D) have not contacted me yet; given quota=1, accepting D now would block a higher-priority match if one applies later. Still, I can only respond to Student_D now; with no guarantee higher-priority students will apply to me (Student_E prefers School_C first and ranks School_B last; Student_B prefers School_A first; Student_C prefers School_B first), there is some chance Student_C will apply soon, making waiting valuable. But rejecting D risks ending up with A or nobody if others don't apply. Considering Student_C’s preference list starts with School_B, I expect C to apply quickly, so I should reject D to preserve the seat for higher-priority C/B/E.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A and I’m applying because School_B is my first choice. I’m especially drawn to your academic environment and I’m ready to commit fully if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing the only seat. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still optimal because (1) I cannot improve my priority by waiting, and (2) if higher-priority students also apply, I will be rejected quickly and can move to my next choices in later rounds. I will send a strong but concise application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:

Student_D (ranked above A) also applied this round, and I already rejected D previously to preserve capacity for even higher-ranked candidates. Therefore, I should reject Student_A to keep the seat available for E/B/C.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a place. Thank you for considering my application.

In contrast, at School_A I am ranked 1st in priority, and School_A is still my 3rd true choice—high enough to be very satisfied. Applying to School_A now should secure an immediate match and avoids the risk of being rejected from School_C and then facing competition elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_A. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_A. Please confirm your enrollment and we will share next steps for registration and orientation.

With quota 1 and no higher-priority candidate possible, accepting now secures the best attainable match for School_A and avoids the risk of losing Student_E to a higher-ranked option on their preference list (School_C/School_D) in later rounds.

conversation.message:

I’m especially excited about the chance to contribute to your community and would be ready to commit fully if admitted.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,

Among remaining unmatched schools, School_E is higher on my true preference list than School_D, and School_E ranks me first in its priority list, making acceptance very likely if I apply now. Locking in School_E secures a good outcome rather than risking ending up at my last choice.

Student_D is lowest on our priority list anyway, so there is no strategic reason to attempt to change the current match.
